snippet: For perhaps the first time, conservatives opposed to a nuclear deal with the West seem to have become disconnected from the power structure in Iran.
abstract: Iranian Interior Ministry's condemnation of protesters who objected to concessions made over nuclear deal with West is sign of how top Iranian officials, clerics, lawmakers and Revolutionary Guard commanders are lining up to support deal; Gen Mohammad Ali Jafari, highest-ranking commander in Revolutionary Guards Corps, joins chorus of those lauding Mohammad Javad Zarif and his team of negotiators, as well as government of Pres Hassan Rouhani.
lead_paragraph: For perhaps the first time, conservatives opposed to a nuclear deal with the West seem to have become disconnected from the power structure in Iran.

headline.main: Iran’s Leaders Fall Into Line Behind Nuclear Accord
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Leaders Fall Into Line Behind Accord
